Name.label: Dysostosis with brachydactyly without extraskeletal manifestations

TextSection.Contents: Sugarman brachydactyly is a rare, genetic, congenital limb malformation characterized by brachydactyly of fingers, with major proximal phalangeal shortening and immobile proximal interphalangeal joints, as well as dorsally and proximally placed, non-articulating great toes (with or without angulation). Radiographic findings of hands include bilateral double first metacarpals and biphalangeal fifth fingers. There have been no further descriptions in the literature since 1982.

Name.label: E (exact mapping (the terms and the concepts are equivalent))
